welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: ## Welcome! You are currently looking at the discord-akairo v7 tutorials. ## Links - [Website](https://discord-akairo.github.io) - [Repository](https://github.com/discord-akairo/discord-akairo) - [Changelog](https://github.com/discord-akairo/discord-akairo/releases) - [Discord](https://discord.gg/arTauDY)

setup.name: Setting Up
setup.content:
# Setting Up

### Installation

Before even doing anything else, you of course have to install the Discord.js and Akairo.  

`npm install discord.js`  
`npm install discord-akairo`  

If you feel like working with SQLite or Sequelize later, install that too.  

`npm install sqlite`  
`npm install sequelize`  

Once everything has been installed, your working directory should look something like this:  

```
mybot
|____ node_modules
      bot.js
```

### Main File

Inside `bot.js`, require `discord-akairo` and create your client:  

```js
const { AkairoClient } = require('discord-akairo');

const client = new AkairoClient();

client.login('TOKEN');
```

There are some options that you may want to use with your client.  
Let's setup the owner, the prefix for commands, and the directory for commands.  
If you would like to have multiple owners or multiple prefixes, simply add those with an array.  
We want to use Discord.js's `disableEveryone` option too.  

```js
const { AkairoClient } = require('discord-akairo');

const client = new AkairoClient({
    ownerID: '123992700587343872', // or ['123992700587343872', '86890631690977280']
    prefix: '?', // or ['?', '!']
    commandDirectory: './commands/'
}, {
    disableEveryone: true
});

client.login('TOKEN');
```

Now, your folder should look like this:  

```
mybot
|____ node_modules
|____ commands
      bot.js
```

Your bot should now login, and you are ready to make commands.

clientutil.name: ClientUtil
clientutil.content:
# ClientUtil

### Finding Things

ClientUtil is a class filled with utility methods.  
It is available on your client as `client.util`.  

There are three "groups" of resolver methods for finding or checking Discord-related things.  
They allow you to, for example, find a user named `1Computer` from an input of `comp`.  

- `resolve <thing>`
    - e.g. `resolveUser`, `resolveChannel`, etc.
    - Finds an Discord-related object from a collection of those objects.

- `resolve <things>`
    - e.g. `resolveUsers`, `resolveChannels`, etc.
    - Filters Discord-related objects from a collection of those objects.

- `check <thing>`
    - e.g. `checkUser`, `checkChannel`, etc.
    - Used for the above methods, checks if a string could be referring to the object.

### Other Methods

There are a bunch of other things you may find useful:  

- `embed` and `collection`
    - Shortcuts for RichEmbed and Collection.
- `resolvePermissionNumber`
    - Converts a permission number to an array of permission names.
- `prompt` and `promptIn`
    - Creates custom prompts.
    - Can check reply with a regex or function.

classes.name: AkairoClient
classes.description:
The Akairo framework client.
Creates the handlers and sets them up.

params.name: clientOptions
params.description:
Options for Discord JS client.
If not specified, the previous options parameter is used instead.

props.name: selfbot
props.description: Whether or not this is a selfbot.

methods.name: addDatabase
methods.description: Adds a database that will be initialized once ready.

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Logins the client, creates message listener, and initialize databases.
Resolves once client is ready.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the client by creating the handlers.

params.name: classToHandle
params.description:
Only instances of this can be handled.
Exports not instance of this class are ignored.

props.name: modules
props.description: Modules loaded, mapped by ID to AkairoModule.

methods.name: loadAll
methods.description: Reads all modules from the directory and loads them.

methods.name: load

params.description:
Filename to lookup in the directory.
A .js extension is assumed.

methods.description: Casts the type of this argument onto a word.

params.name: wholeWord

params.name: wholeWord

methods.name: displayRole
methods.description: Gets the role which is used to display the member's color.

methods.description: Gets the display color in decimal of the member.

methods.name: displayHexColor
methods.description: Gets the display color in hex code of the member.

methods.name: hoistRole
methods.description: Gets the role which is used to hoist the member.

methods.name: resolvePermissionNumber
methods.description: Resolves a permission number and returns an array of permission names.

methods.name: resolvePermissionOverwrite
methods.description:
Resolves a channel permission overwrite.
Returns an object with the allow and deny arrays of permission names.

methods.name: compareStreaming
methods.description:
Compares two member objects presences and checks if they stopped or started a stream or not.
Returns 0, 1, or 2 for no change, stopped, or started.

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether or not to add to cache.

methods.name: prompt
methods.description: Prompts a user for input, returning the message that passes.

params.name: check
params.description: Regex or function to check if message should pass.

methods.name: promptIn
methods.description: Prompts a user for input in a specific channel, returning the message that passes.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel to prompt in or a user to prompt in DM.

params.name: user
params.description: User to prompt, if not a user object in the channel param.

params.name: check
params.description: Regex or function to check if message should pass.

methods.name: fetchMessage
methods.description: Fetches a message, works for both bots and user accounts.

props.name: editable

props.description: Permissions required to run command by the client.

props.name: userPermissions

props.name: blockNotSelf

props.name: blockClient

props.name: fetchMembers

props.name: commandUtilLifetime

props.name: prompts
props.description: Collection of sets of ongoing argument prompts.

props.name: modules
props.description: Modules loaded, mapped by ID to AkairoModule.

methods.name: allowMention

methods.name: addPrompt

methods.name: hasPrompt
methods.description: Checks if there is an ongoing prompt.

params.name: edited
params.description: Whether or not the message was edited.

methods.name: _parseCommand
methods.description: Parses the command and its argument list.

methods.name: _handleCooldowns
methods.description: Handles cooldowns and checks if a user is under cooldown.

params.name: edited
params.description: Whether or not the message was edited.

params.name: edited
params.description: Whether or not the message was edited.

params.name: edited
params.description: Whether or not the message was edited.

Filename to lookup in the directory.
A .js extension is assumed.

events.name: messageBlocked
events.description:
Emitted when a message is blocked by a pre-message inhibitor.
The built-in inhibitors are 'notSelf' (for selfbots), 'client', and 'bot'.

events.name: messageInvalid
events.description: Emitted when a message does not start with the prefix or match a command.

events.name: commandDisabled
events.description: Emitted when a command is found disabled.

events.name: commandBlocked
events.description:
Emitted when a command is blocked by a post-message inhibitor.
The built-in inhibitors are 'owner', 'guild', 'dm', 'clientPermissions', and 'userPermissions'.

events.name: commandCooldown
events.description: Emitted when a command is found on cooldown.

params.name: edited
params.description: Whether or not the command came from an edited message.

params.name: edited
params.description: Whether or not the command came from an edited message.

events.name: inPrompt
events.description:
Emitted when a user is in a command argument prompt.
Used to prevent usage of commands during a prompt.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when a command or inhibitor errors.

props.name: shouldEdit
props.description: Whether or not the last response should be edited.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a response or edits an old response if available.

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Sends a response or edits an old response if available.

methods.name: sendCode
methods.description: Sends a response in a codeblock or edits an old response if available.

methods.name: sendEmbed
methods.description: Sends a response with an embed or edits an old response if available.

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Sends a response with a mention concantenated to it.

methods.name: swapOptions
methods.description: Swaps and cleans up content and options.

params.name: exec
params.description: Function called before a command is ran.

props.name: modules
props.description: Modules loaded, mapped by ID to AkairoModule.

methods.name: test
methods.description:
Tests inhibitors against the message.
Rejects with the reason if blocked.

methods.name: loadAll
methods.description: Reads all modules from the directory and loads them.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Loads a module, can be a filepath or an object.

params.name: isReload
params.description: Whether this is a reload or not.

params.name: filename
params.description:
Filename to lookup in the directory.
A .js extension is assumed.

classes.name: ListenerHandler
classes.description: Loads listeners and registers them with EventEmitters.

props.name: emitters
props.description:
EventEmitters for use, mapped by name to EventEmitter.
By default, 'client', 'commandHandler', 'inhibitorHandler', 'listenerHandler' are set.
Databases added through the client are also added here.

props.name: modules
props.description: Modules loaded, mapped by ID to AkairoModule.

methods.description: Reads all modules from the directory and loads them.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Loads a module, can be a filepath or an object.

params.description: Whether this is a reload or not.

params.name: filename
params.description:
Filename to lookup in the directory.

classes.name: SQLiteHandler
classes.description:
Creates an SQLiteHandler.
Tables must have an 'id' column.

props.name: json
props.description: Keys to parse and stringify as JSON.

props.name: memory
props.description: Configurations stored in memory, mapped by ID to configuration.

props.name: ids
props.description:
Array of IDs.
Note that this calls the Collection's keyArray().

props.name: configs
props.description:
Array of configs.
Note that this calls the Collection's array().
Values from here should be desanitized.

methods.name: sanitize
methods.description:
Sanitizes a string by replacing single quotes with two single quotes.
Can return a non-string if json is set to false.

methods.name: desanitize
methods.description:
Desanitizes a string for use by replacing two single quotes with a single quote.
Can return a non-string if json is set to true.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the database so that it can be used.

methods.name: load
methods.description:
Loads handler and database with IDs.
Use manually if you want to load database before client is ready.

params.name: keys
params.description:
Specific keys to get.
Leave blank to get the entire configuration.

methods.name: save
methods.description: Saves an in-memory config to the database.

methods.name: saveAll
methods.description: Saves all in-memory configs to the database.

params.name: memory
params.description: Whether or not this was done in memory only.

params.name: memory
params.description: Whether or not this was done in memory only.

params.name: memory
params.description: Whether or not this was done in memory only.

events.name: save
events.description: Emitted when a config was saved from memory.

params.name: newInsert
params.description: Whether or not the config has been in the database before.

events.name: saveAll
events.description: Emitted when many configs were saved from memory.

classes.name: TypeResolver
classes.description:
Type resolver for command arguments.
The types are documented under ArgumentType.

methods.name: type
methods.description: Gets the resolver function for a type.

params.name: types
params.description: Object with keys as the type name and values as the resolver function.

methods.name: reloadAll
methods.description: Calls reload() on all items in this category.

methods.name: removeAll
methods.description: Calls remove() on all items in this category.

methods.name: enableAll
methods.description: Calls enable() on all items in this category.

methods.name: disableAll
methods.description: Calls disable() on all items in this category.

typedefs.name: ProviderOptions
typedefs.description: Options to use for providers.

props.name: idColumn
props.description: Column for the unique key, defaults to 'id'.

props.name: dataColumn
props.description:
Column for JSON data.
If not provided, the provider will use all columns of the table.
If provided, only one column will be used, but it will be more flexible due to being parsed as JSON.
For Sequelize, note that the model has to specify the type of the column as JSON or JSONB.

typedefs.name: AkairoOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to determine how the framework behaves.

props.name: selfbot
props.description: Whether or not this bot is a selfbot.

props.name: allowMention
props.description: Whether or not to allow mentions to the client user as a prefix.

props.name: handleEdits
props.description: Whether or not to handle edited messages.

props.name: commandUtil
props.description:
Whether or not to assign message.util.
Set to true by default if handleEdits is on.

props.name: commandUtilLifetime
props.description:
Milliseconds a command util should last before it is removed.
If 0, command utils will never be removed.

props.name: fetchMembers
props.description: Whether or not to fetch member on each message from a guild.

props.name: blockNotSelf
props.description: Whether or not to block others, if a selfbot.

props.name: blockClient
props.description: Whether or not to block self, if not a selfbot.

props.name: emitters
props.description: Emitters to load onto the listener handler.

props.name: automateCategories
props.description: Whether or not to set each module's category to it's parent directory name

typedefs.name: PrefixFunction
typedefs.description: A function that returns the prefix(es) to use.

typedefs.name: AllowMentionFunction
typedefs.description: A function that returns whether mentions can be used as a prefix.

typedefs.name: ModuleOptions
typedefs.description: Options for module.

typedefs.name: ModuleExecFunction
typedefs.description: The module's execution function.

typedefs.name: MessageOptionsExtensions
typedefs.description:
Extra properties alongside the Discord.js message options type.
Available for use when returning in a prompt function or in CommandUtil.

typedefs.name: ArgumentMatch
typedefs.description:
The method to match arguments from text.

  • word matches by the order of the words inputted.
    It ignores words that matches a prefix or a flag.
  • rest matches the rest of the words in order.
    It ignores words that matches a prefix or a flag.
  • prefix matches words that starts with the prefix.
    The word after the prefix is the evaluated argument.
  • flag matches words that are the same as its prefix.
    The evaluated argument is either true or false.
  • text matches the entire text, except for the command.
    It ignores words that matches a prefix or a flag.
  • content matches the entire text as it was inputted, except for the command.
  • none matches nothing at all and an empty string will be used for type operations.

typedefs.name: ArgumentMatchFunction
typedefs.description: A function returning a method to match arguments.

typedefs.name: ArgumentType
typedefs.description:
The type that the argument should be cast to.

  • string does not cast to any type.
  • lowercase makes the input lowercase.
  • uppercase makes the input uppercase.
  • charCodes transforms the input to an array of char codes.
  • number casts to an number with parseFloat().
  • integer casts to an integer with parseInt().
  • dynamic casts to a number with parseFloat() or a trimmed input if not a number.
  • dynamicInt casts to an integer with parseInt() or a trimmed input if not a number.
  • url casts to an URL object.
  • date casts to a Date object.
  • color casts a hex code to an integer.
  • commandAlias tries to resolve to a command from an alias.
  • command matches the ID of a command.
  • inhibitor matches the ID of an inhibitor.
  • listener matches the ID of a listener.

Possible Discord-related types.
These types can be plural (add an 's' to the end) and a collection of matching objects will be used.

  • user tries to resolve to a user.
  • member tries to resolve to a member.
  • relevant tries to resolve to a relevant user, works in both guilds and DMs.
  • channel tries to resolve to a channel.
  • textChannel tries to resolve to a text channel.
  • voiceChannel tries to resolve to a voice channel.
  • role tries to resolve to a role.
  • emoji tries to resolve to a custom emoji.
  • guild tries to resolve to a guild.

Other Discord-related types:

  • message tries to fetch a message from an ID.
  • invite tries to resolve an invite code from a link.
  • memberMention matches a mention of a guild member.
  • channelMention matches a mention of a channel.
  • roleMention matches a mention of a role.
  • emojiMention matches a mention of an emoji.

An array of strings can be used to restrict input to only those strings, case insensitive.
The array can also contain an inner array of strings, for aliases.
If so, the first entry of the array will be used as the final argument.

A regular expression can also be used.
The evaluated argument will be an object containing the match and groups if global.

typedefs.name: ArgumentTypeFunction
typedefs.description:
A function for processing user input to use as an argument.
A return value of true will let the word pass.
A null or undefined return value will use the default value for the argument or start a prompt.
Any other truthy return value will be used as the evaluated argument.
If returning a Promise, the value resolved will be the argument.
A rejection will use the default value or start a prompt.

typedefs.name: ArgumentPromptOptions
typedefs.description:
A prompt to run if the user did not input the argument correctly.
Can only be used if there is not a default value (unless optional is true).

props.name: cancelWord
props.description: Word to use for cancelling the command.

props.name: stopWord
props.description: Word to use for ending infinite prompts.

props.name: optional
props.description: Prompts only when argument is provided but was not of the right type.

props.name: infinite
props.description:
Prompts forever until the stop word, cancel word, time limit, or retry limit.
Note that the retry count resets back to one on each valid entry.
The final evaluated argument will be an array of the inputs.

props.name: limit
props.description: Amount of inputs allowed for an infinite prompt before finishing.

props.name: retry
props.description: Text sent on a retry (failure to cast type).

props.name: ended
props.description: Text sent on amount of tries reaching the max.

typedefs.name: ArgumentPromptFunction
typedefs.description:
A function returning text for the prompt or a MessageOptions object.
The options can have an extra optional property called content for message content.

params.name: tries
params.description: The amount of tries the user has taken.

typedefs.name: ArgumentOptions
typedefs.description: Options for how an argument parses text.

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the argument for use in the args object.

props.name: prefix
props.description: The string(s) to use as the flag for prefix and flag args.

props.name: index
props.description:
Index/word of text to start from.
Applicable to word, text, or content match only.

props.name: default
props.description:
Default value if text does not parse or cast correctly.
If using a flag arg, setting the default value inverses the result.

props.name: prompt
props.description:
Prompt options for when user does not provide input.
Must not have a default value for this to work.

typedefs.name: ArgumentDefaultFunction
typedefs.description: Function get the default value of the argument.

typedefs.name: PromptCheckFunction
typedefs.description: Function used to check if a response should pass for the prompt.

typedefs.name: CommandOptions
typedefs.description: Options to use for command execution behavior.

props.name: ownerOnly
props.description: Whether or not to allow client owner(s) only.

props.name: protected
props.description: Whether or not this command cannot be disabled.

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not to type in channel during execution.

props.name: editable
props.description:
Whether or not message edits will run this command.
On an edited message, the exec function edited param will be true.

props.name: ratelimit
props.description: Amount of command uses allowed until cooldown.

props.name: prefix
props.description: The prefix(es) to overwrite the global one for this command.

props.name: userPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the user to run this command.

props.name: clientPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the client to run this command.

props.name: trigger
props.description:
A regex to match in messages that are NOT commands.
The exec function becomes ((message, match, groups, edited) => any).

props.name: condition
props.description:
Whether or not to run on messages that are NOT commands.
The exec function becomes ((message, edited) => any).

typedefs.name: PermissionFunction
typedefs.description: A function used to check if a message has permissions for the command.

typedefs.name: TriggerFunction
typedefs.description: A function used to return a regular expression.

typedefs.name: ConditionFunction
typedefs.description: A function used to check if the command should run.

typedefs.name: ArgumentSplit
typedefs.description:
The method to split text into words.

  • plain splits word separated by whitespace.
    Extra whitespace between words are ignored.
  • split splits word separated by whitespace.
    Should not be used due to possible inconsistent whitespace.
    DEPRECATED: no alternatives.
  • quoted is similar to plain, but counts text inside double quotes as one word.
  • sticky is similar to quoted, but makes it so that quoted text must have a whitespace or another double quote before it.
    This means that thing="hello world" would be one, rather than two like when using quoted.
  • none gives the entire content.

It is recommended that you use either plain or sticky for your commands.

A regex or a character can be used instead (for example, a comma) to split the message by that regex or character.

typedefs.name: ArgumentSplitFunction
typedefs.description: A function that returns the words to use for the arguments.

params.name: content
params.description: The message content without the prefix and command.

typedefs.name: CommandExecFunction
typedefs.description: The command's execution function.

params.name: edited
params.description:
Whether the user's message was edited.
DEPRECATED: Use Messaged#edited.

typedefs.name: RegexCommandExecFunction
typedefs.description: The command's execution function when triggered with a regex.

params.name: groups
params.description: The matched groups if a global regex.

params.name: edited
params.description:
Whether the user's message was edited.
DEPRECATED: Use Messaged#edited.

typedefs.name: ConditionalCommandExecFunction
typedefs.description: The command's execution function when triggered with a condition.

params.name: edited
params.description:
Whether the user's message was edited.
DEPRECATED: Use Messaged#edited.

typedefs.name: MessageExtensions
typedefs.description: Extra properties applied to the Discord.js message object.

props.name: util
props.description:
Utilities for command responding.
Available on all messages after 'all' inhibitors and built-in inhibitors (bot, client, notSelf).
Not all properties of the util are available, depending on the input.

typedefs.name: InhibitorOptions
typedefs.description: Options to use for inhibitor execution behavior.

props.name: reason
props.description: Reason emitted when command or message is blocked.

props.name: type
props.description: Can be 'all' to run on all messages, 'pre' to run on messages not blocked by the built-in inhibitors, or 'post' to run on messages that are commands.

typedefs.name: InhibitorExecFunction
typedefs.description:
Function to check if message should be blocked.
A return value of true or a rejecting Promise will block the message.

typedefs.name: ListenerOptions
typedefs.description: Options to use for listener execution behavior.

props.name: emitter
props.description: The event emitter, either a key from ListenerHandler#emitters or an EventEmitter.

typedefs.name: ListenerExecFunction
typedefs.description: Function called when event emitted.

typedefs.name: SQLiteOptions
typedefs.description: Options to use for the SQLiteHandler.

props.name: json
props.description: Array of keys to parse and stringify as JSON.

props.name: init
props.description:
IDs to use to initialize database.
If you want to load the database before login, use SQLiteHandler#load.

typedefs.name: SQLiteInitFunction
typedefs.description: Function used to get IDs for database.
